bug.author: eugeneware
bug.summary: jupyter metadata logging fails if password is set (not using token auth)
bug.description:
wandb --version && python --version && uname
Weights and Biases version: 0.8.5 Python version: 3.7.3 Operating System: Linux
<denchmark-h:h3>Description</denchmark-h>
When trying to log any data to wandb when jupyter notebook is set to have a password, you get an error Failed to query for notebook kernels: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38154/61617049-48127680-acad-11e9-8b3d-991bd7b55395.png></denchmark-link>
Under some circumstances this exception is not caught at all and crashes training with a similar stack trace: <denchmark-code>Failed to query for notebook sessions Traceback (most recent call last): File "/home/fastai/anaconda2/envs/keyword-extraction/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/jupyter.py", line 95, in notebook_metadata res = requests.get(urljoin(s['url'], 'api/sessions'), params={'token': s.get('token', '')}).json() File "/home/fastai/anaconda2/envs/keyword-extraction/lib/python3.7/site-packages/requests/models.py", line 897, in json return complexjson.loads(self.text, **kwargs) File "/home/fastai/anaconda2/envs/keyword-extraction/lib/python3.7/json/__init__.py", line 348, in loads return _default_decoder.decode(s) File "/home/fastai/anaconda2/envs/keyword-extraction/lib/python3.7/json/decoder.py", line 337, in decode obj, end = self.raw_decode(s, idx=_w(s, 0).end()) File "/home/fastai/anaconda2/envs/keyword-extraction/lib/python3.7/json/decoder.py", line 355, in raw_decode raise JSONDecodeError("Expecting value", s, err.value) from None json.decoder.JSONDecodeError: Expecting value: line 1 column 1 (char 0) </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h3>What I Did</denchmark-h>
Set a password for jupyter notebook by editing .jupyter/jupyter_notebook_config.py to have a password. What this means is that no metadata about the jupyter notebook is logged to wandb:
# sets the password to "hello" c.NotebookApp.password = u'sha1:ce33f1754029:ba4f0af9b0a9a5da036ae6649d4515a85c2fe211'
Create a new jupyter notebook and try to log anything:
<denchmark-code>import wandb wandb.init() wandb.log({'x': 123}) </denchmark-code>
The Failed to query for notebook kernels error is shown and no metadata from jupyter is logged.
<denchmark-h:h3>Root Cause</denchmark-h>
This <denchmark-link:https://github.com/wandb/client/blob/master/wandb/jupyter.py#L95>line of code</denchmark-link> assumes that there is a token available. This is only true for token authentication. If you set a password for your jupyter server (very common!) the field will be blank from : <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38154/61617630-6f1d7800-acae-11e9-9d10-11cef88daad5.png></denchmark-link>
The API call to /api/sessions then fails as the authentication fails. There are a few solutions in this <denchmark-link:https://stackoverflow.com/questions/40000657/interact-with-password-protected-jupyter-api>Stack overflow</denchmark-link> post - but none are ideal as you have to pass the password through.

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.96. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/wandb/client>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
Thanks for this detailed analysis! We'll circle internally and comeup with a solution.
Specifically we just don't log the notebook name, but you can set it with the WANDB_NOTEBOOK_NAME env variable
